posts.post_content:
**Andrew's Occasional Random Card of the Day #3 - 6/29/2011 - Sylvan Messenger**  
  
With such a big war going on in their setting, Invasion block's card names often surprise me. It's full of acolytes, disciples, apprentices, emissaries, and apparently messengers. Regardless, though, this card is funny in a different way; it's a tribal card in a block about multicolor. A quick search shows me only three Elves in Apocalypse, including this one, while there are sixteen in the Invasion block. One of those is [Elvish Champion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Champion), though, so it's hard to argue there. Still, [Sylvan Messenger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sylvan Messenger) feels a little out of place. It's even too early to be a 'plant' for Onslaught, since Odyssey block was a buffer between the two in terms of the Standard format.  
  
I'm not an Elf-deck-type, so I could be off, but I've never even really seen this card in decks of its genre, apart from its inclusion in the Elves vs Goblins Duel Deck. Contrariwise, its counterpart autoc... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Andrew's Occasional Random Card of the Day #3 - 6/29/2011 - Sylvan Messenger

With such a big war going on in their setting, Invasion block's card names often surprise me. It's full of acolytes, disciples, apprentices, emissaries, and apparently messengers. Regardless, though, this card is funny in a different way; it's a tribal card in a block about multicolor. A quick search shows me only three Elves in Apocalypse, including this one, while there are sixteen in the Invasion block. One of those is Elvish Champion, though, so it's hard to argue there. Still, Sylvan Messenger feels a little out of place. It's even too early to be a 'plant' for Onslaught, since Odyssey block was a buffer between the two in terms of the Standard format.

I'm not an Elf-deck-type, so I could be off, but I've never even really seen this card in decks of its genre, apart from its inclusion in the Elves vs Goblins Duel Deck. Contrariwise, its counterpart autoc... (see all)

posts.post_content: This is not as good as the goblin version since Goblin Lackey is so awesome, but this is the second best of the cycle. Elves can pump it out pretty quickly. It's just that Regal Force ends up superior most of the time, and elves can indeed get that much mana pretty easily.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
4:39 [Stalker\_Hag](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=151120): Hi  
4:39 Stalker\_Hag: How are you doing?  
4:40 Stalker\_Hag: I miss you.  
4:40 Stalker\_Hag: \*erm\*  
4:41 Stalker\_Hag: ?  
4:44 Stalker\_Hag: Hi, are you there?  
4:44 Stalker\_Hag: Are you okay?  
4:45 Stalker\_Hag: I hope you still aren't mad about what happened at the [Sylvan Library](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sylvan Library) the other night. I told [Wormwood Dryad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wormwood Dryad) not to keep it going. It was just an in-joke from middle school.  
5:32 Stalker\_Hag: Why haven't you added me on Sylvan Facebook yet?  
11:45 Stalker\_Hag: Well, IM me when you get this message.  
12:01 Stalker\_Hag: I'm really worried about you.  
3:28 Stalker\_Hag: Well, my parents are making me go to bed.  
3:31 Stalker\_Hag: Call me in the morning. <3 :)  
Stalker\_Hag has disconnected.
